cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles south-southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River (355 mi SSW of New Orleans, Louisiana)
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north then accelerate north-northeast, making landfall in southeastern Louisiana this afternoon, then race northeastward across the Southeast U.S. and reach the Mid-Atlantic coast late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (near Morgan City – Port Fourchon area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Morgan City LA to MS/AL border; Storm-surge warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL including Lakes Borgne, Pontchartrain & Mobile Bay; Tropical-storm warning MS/AL border to Walton/Bay County Line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana through the Mississippi and Alabama coasts) then inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30-45 kt) possible Thursday as the remnant core passes nearby
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge or coastal flooding (<2 ft) possible in Chesapeake Bay and tidal Potomac
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Thursday could total 2–4 in., locally higher, producing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands Thursday; brief visibility reductions and strong squalls could disrupt port operations
